etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in John Lyly (1554–1606), writer and playwright. From paper + flower

definitions: An imitation flower made from paper.

Any of several plants with flowers or bracts of a papery texture, especially (a) US a small shrub of the family Asteraceae (Compositae), Psilostrophe cooperi, native to south-western desert areas of the United States and bearing panicles of yellow flowers; (b) a bougainvillea, especially Bougainvillea glabra.
